taskbody.context: Use this procedure to stop the service (serviced) on the master host in a high-availability deployment.

step.cmd: Use the virtual hostname or virtual IP address of the high-availability cluster to log in to the master node .
Display the public hostname of the current node.
step.stepresult: Make a note of which node (primary or secondary) is the current node, for use in a subsequent step.

step.cmd: Stop with the cluster management tool.
Monitor the status of cluster resources.
step.stepresult: Monitor the status until all resources report Stopped. Resolve any issues before continuing.

step.cmd: Ensure that no containers remain in the local repository.

substep.cmd: Display the identifiers of all containers, running and exited.
substep.stepresult: If the command returns a result, enter the following command: docker ps -qa | xargs --no-run-if-empty docker rm -fv

step.cmd: To ensure that no containers remain in both Docker repositories, log in to the other master node , and then perform the preceding step.
